p.strong: New York on PAUSE, including school closures, has been extended through at least May 15.
In-person screenings for incoming kindergartners have been suspended.
Read the [email protected]: Supporting Social Emotional Learning resource for families.

div.p: Child Care Resources of Rockland is working with local school districts to coordinate childcare for families of emergency personnel and other essential workers. Read the CCRR 4/13/20 Update: English | Spanish

p.strong: The New York State Education Department canceled June Regents Exams and issued guidance on graduation requirements.

div.p: The June SAT exams are canceled; view information on the College Board website. AP exams dates and information are posted here.

p.strong: View the Distance Learning Plan and parent guide (English | Español).

div.p: Free breakfast and lunch is available via pickup on Tuesdays and Thursdays or via weekly home delivery on Tuesdays. View details on the Food Service webpage.
The Annual Board of Education Election and Budget Vote has been postponed to at least June 1.

p.strong: Find a list of school events that have been canceled or postponed
Read the updated COVID-19 School Closure FAQ.
View the District’s COVID-19 related communications archive.

div.p: Questions or concerns? Please email [email protected] or call (845) 680-1090, Monday through Friday, between 9:00AM-2:00PM. Our Hotline call menu is as follows:

ul.li: Press 3 for Counseling, Special Education, and Meal Delivery
Press 5 for all other matters related to the mandated closure

div.p: All emails and calls will receive a response within 24 hours. In the event of an emergency, please call 911.

The New York State Office of Mental Health’s new Emotional Support Helpline provides free and confidential help to those feeling anxious due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The Helpline is open 8AM-10PM, 7 days a week. Call 1+ (844) 863-9314.
